blocks.text: Volumes of Solids of Revolutionâ€”A solid of revolution is generated by the rotation of some decided figure round an axis which does not cut the figure. Thus, given the right circular cone, the cylinder and the area are solids of revolution, being generated respectively by the revolution of a right-angled triangle, a rectangle about one of its sides, and the circle about its diameter.

The method of obtaining the volumes of solids of revolution is the integral method. The equations of revolution that form the right circular cone, cylinder and hyperbola are derived from its axes and occur in the design of these examples. The axes about which the revolution takes place matter much.
Imagine the revolving cone hurts the side and character shown in the sketch ABCD; and let MN be the section of semi chord; the volume will be the volume of the solid of revolution.
